description: The OTM Open Alarm Trap with an otmSeverity
of critical(1).
This trap is intended to be internationalizable
hence, it contains no natural language text.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OtmOpenAlarm::otmOpenAlarmCritical OtmOpenAlarm::otmSeqNumber i 4 OtmOpenAlarm::otmDateAndTime s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEE OtmOpenAlarm::otmSeverity i 1 OtmOpenAlarm::otmNameSpace i 1 OtmOpenAlarm::otmType s EXAMPLE OtmOpenAlarm::otmSite s EXAMPLE OtmOpenAlarm::otmSystem s EXAMPLE OtmOpenAlarm::otmSystemComponent s EXAMPLE OtmOpenAlarm::otmOriginatingAgent s EXAMPLE OtmOpenAlarm::otmOptivityTrapType i 1 OtmOpenAlarm::otmAssocUser s EXAMPLE OtmOpenAlarm::otmProblemIsolationData1 s EXAMPLE OtmOpenAlarm::otmProblemIsolationData2 s EXAMPLE OtmOpenAlarm::otmProblemIsolationData3 s EXAMPLE

description: Sequence number of the alarm; starts at 1 and increments by 1; must be unique for all alarms received from otmSource.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmSeqNumber

description: Time at which the alarm occurred.
Its format is YYYY MM DD HH MM SS hh;
hh may equal 00.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmDateAndTime

description: The severity of the alarm.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmSeverity

description: This field, plus otmAlarmType, assigns a universally unique name to the trap. Values of this field are allocated by personnel at Nortel Networks, MPK.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmNameSpace

description: The type of the alarm.
The value of this field is unique within the name space defined by otmAlarmNameSpace.
The format of this object is device-dependent.
The Meridian 1 format is AAAA9999, where the numeric portion is unique within the alpha portion.
The SL-100 format is AAAAA99999, where the numeric portion is unique within the alpha portion.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmType

description: The site associated with otmSystem. This site may contain or be a grouping of several systems.
The format of this object is device-dependent.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmSite

description: The alarm's source - the name of the
largest containing object to be identified as the alarm's emitter.
The format of this object is device-dependent.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmSystem

description: A component within otmSystem emitting the alarm.
The format of this object is device-dependent.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmSystemComponent

description: The IP address of the SNMP agent that originated the trap.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmOriginatingAgent

description: Indicates this trap fits the definition of a specific Optivity-defined trap type.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmOptivityTrapType

description: Name of the user most closely associated with
the alarm (e.g., the user of the application that
emits the alarm).
The format of this object is device-dependent.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmAssocUser

description: Data useful in isolating the problem
represented by the alarm.
The format of this object is device-dependent.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmProblemIsolationData1

description: Data useful in isolating the problem
represented by the alarm.
An extension to otmProblemIsolationData1.
The format of this object is device-dependent.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmProblemIsolationData2

description: Data useful in isolating the problem
represented by the alarm.
An extension to otmProblemIsolationData2.
The format of this object is device-dependent.
variables.name: OtmOpenAlarm::otmProblemIsolationData3

description: The OTM Open Alarm Trap with a severity
of major(2).
This trap is intended to be internationalizable
hence, it contains no natural language text.
